N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 100.1 - Applications

State Regulations
(a) Applications
from counties, part-counties and cities for State aid for operating costs must
be received in quadruplicate in the appropriate regional office of the State

Department of Mental Hygiene no later than the day prior to the first day for
which State aid will be claimed under the provisions of article 11 of the

Mental Hygiene Law. (b) The
application must be accompanied by: (1)
A
budget summary which identifies each service and facility and shows the total
sum budgeted for each. (2)

Detailed
budgets of proposed expenditures as adopted for the local governmental
unit. (3)

Copies of contracts for
the rendition of services or the operation of facilities by private and/or
voluntary agencies. (4)

Copies of
agreements or resolutions of the governing body for the rendition of services
or operation of facilities by agencies of the city or county other than the
local governmental unit. (5)

Copies
of the certificates of appointment and the names, terms of office and
identification by position or occupation of the members of the community mental
health, retardation, and alcoholism services boards. (c) The budget of the local governmental
unit, as submitted, must give a detailed financial statement of each
subdivision. This must include titles, annual salary rates or amounts for each
position, amounts budgeted for traveling expenses, purchase of equipment, purchase of automobiles or other motor vehicles, rental of space, amounts for
other expenses and the expected income from all sources. Such budgets shall be
on forms provided by the State Department of Mental Hygiene. Notes
